awd_abstract_narration: The principal investigator will study whether the analog of                the strong law of large numbers holds for reinforced random walk                on the integers, whenever the initial weightings are equal, under               arbitrary past dependent reinforcement.  He also will investigate               recurrence of two dimensional, and n dimensional, reinforced                    random walk.  In addition, he proposes to find necessary and                    sufficient geometrical conditions for certain classes of domains,               including the class of those domains in R**2 with boundary in a                 sense given locally by the graph of a function, for the semigroup               connected with the Dirichlet Laplacian to be intrinsically                      ultracontractive.                                                                    The principal investigator will conduct research at the                    interface between probability and analysis.  He will work on two                classes of problems:  reinforced random walk, and intrinsic                     ultracontractivity.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
